module.name: Aurduino CAN shield sample1
module.description: This is a simple test VSCP based module constructed on the Arduino Duemilanove board with a CAN shield from Sparcfun.

picture.description: Picture of the Aurduino CAN shield sample1 module.

manual.description: Full manual for the Aurduino CAN shield sample1 module.

reg.name: Zone
reg.description: Zone this module belongs to

reg.name: Subzone
reg.description: Subzone this module belongs to

reg.name: Control register for digital port D3.
reg.description:
Bit 0: Current state of port bit.
 Bit 1: 0=Input, 1=output.
 Bit 2: Enable pull up if set to one.

bit.name: Port status
bit.description: Current state of port bit.

bit.name: Port direction
bit.description: 0=Input, 1=output.

bit.name: Port pull up
bit.description: Enable pull up if set to one.

bit.name: Reserved
bit.description: Reserved

bit.name: Reserved
bit.description: Reserved

bit.name: Reserved
bit.description: Reserved

bit.name: Reserved
bit.description: Reserved

bit.name: Reserved
bit.description: Reserved

reg.name: Control register for analog input A0.
reg.description: Currently not used.

reg.name: Analog converter A0 - MSB byte.
reg.description: Most significant byte of analog converter A0.

reg.name: Analog converter A0 - LSB byte.
reg.description: Least significant byte of analog converter A0.

reg.name: Serial port control (r/w).
reg.description:
Bit 0: Activate port if set to one. This is
 persistant so if set to one the port
 will be open automatically on next restart
 of board.
 Bit 1: If set to one send stream events for
 incoming data on serial port.
 Bit 2: Set to one to send stream data with zone/subzone.

bit.name: Activate serial port
bit.description: Activate port if set to one. This is persistant so if set to one the port will be open automatically on next restart of board.

bit.name: Enable stream
bit.description: If set to one send stream events for incoming data on serial port.

bit.name: Use zone/subzone
bit.description: Set to one to send stream data with zone/subzone.

bit.name: Reserved
bit.description: Reserved

bit.name: Reserved
bit.description: Reserved

bit.name: Reserved
bit.description: Reserved

bit.name: Reserved
bit.description: Reserved

bit.name: Reserved
bit.description: Reserved

reg.name: Serial baudrate - MSB byte.
reg.description:
Set serial baudrate here.
 The actual baudrate change happens when the LSB 
 byte is written so it is important to write MSB 
 byte first and then LSB.

reg.name: Serial baudrate - LSB byte.
reg.description:
Set serial baudrate here.
 The actual baudrate change happens when the LSB 
 byte is written so it is important to write MSB 
 byte first and then LSB.

reg.name: Joystick control.
reg.description:
Bit 0: Add index of joystick button to subzone
 before sending On-event.
 Bit 1: Add code of joystick button to subzone
 before sending Button-event.
 Bit 2: On event is sent if zero, button events if set to one.

bit.name: Add index
bit.description: Add index of joystick button to subzone before sending On-event.

bit.name: Add code
bit.description: Add code of joystick button to subzone before sending Button-event.

bit.name: Event type
bit.description: On event is sent if zero, button events if set to one.

bit.name: Reserved
bit.description: Reserved

bit.name: Reserved
bit.description: Reserved

bit.name: Reserved
bit.description: Reserved

bit.name: Reserved
bit.description: Reserved

bit.name: Reserved
bit.description: Reserved

reg.name: ON-event zone.
reg.description: Zone used for ON-events.

reg.name: ON-event subzone.
reg.description: subzone used for ON-events.

reg.name: Button-event zone.
reg.description: Zone used for Button-events.

reg.name: Button-event subzone.
reg.description: subzone used for Button-events.

reg.name: IO-event frequency.
reg.description: Second between I/O state events. Set to zero\n to disable. See events below.

reg.name: A/D-event frequency.
reg.description: Second between A/D state events. Set to zero\n to disable. See events below.

reg.name: LED control.
reg.description:
Two LED's connected to D7 and D8 can be controlled
 or monitored through this register. D7 can be used freely
 but D8 is also used as status LED by the VSCP subcode.
 Note: This register is not persistant!
 Bit 0 - LED on D7.
 Bit 1 - LED on D8 (status LED).

bit.name: LED D7
bit.description: Control LED D7. 1=On, 0=Off.

bit.name: LED D8
bit.description: Control LED D8. 1=On, 0=Off. This is also the status LED used by the VSCP subsystem.

bit.name: Reserved
bit.description: Reserved.

bit.name: Reserved
bit.description: Reserved

bit.name: Reserved
bit.description: Reserved

bit.name: Reserved
bit.description: Reserved

bit.name: Reserved
bit.description: Reserved

bit.name: Reserved
bit.description: Reserved

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1 - originating address
reg.description: Row 1 of decision matrix. Originating address. Set to nickname for node that should trigger action. Oaddr is the originating address. We are only interested in messages from the node given here. 0×00 is segment controller and 0xff is a node without a nickname. If bit 6 of flags is set oaddr will not be checked and events from all nodes will be accepted.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: flags
reg.description:
Row 1 of decision matrix. Flags. Set selection behaviour.
 The enable bit can be used to disable a decion matrix row while it is edited.
 The zone and use subzone bits can be activated to have a check on the zone/subzone information of an event. That is the zone/subzone of the machine must match the one of the event to trigger the DM row.

bit.name: Class filter bit 8
bit.description: Defines the ninth bit of the class filter.

bit.name: Class mask bit 8
bit.description: Defines the ninth bit of the class mask.

bit.name: Reserved bit
bit.description: This bit is not used.

bit.name: Subzone match
bit.description: If set to one subzone should be matched to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Zone match
bit.description: If set to one zone should be matched to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Hardcoded
bit.description: If set to one the originating address should be hardcoded to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Check Originating address
bit.description: If set to one the originating address should be checked and match to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Enable
bit.description: Enable (1) or disable (0)the decison matrix row.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Class mask (low eight bits)
reg.description: The lowest eight bits of the class mask that defines the events that should trigger the action of thsi decision matrix row.\n Bit 8 of the class mask is stored in bit 1 of the flag byte.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Class filter (low eight bits)
reg.description: The lowest eight bits of the class filter that defines the events that should trigger the action of thsi decision matrix row.\n Bit 8 of the class filter is stored in bit 1 of the flag byte.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Type mask
reg.description: Type mask that defines the events that should trigger the action of this decision matrix row.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Type filter
reg.description: Type filter that defines the events that should trigger the action of this decision matrix row.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Action
reg.description: This is the action or operation that should be performed if the filtering is satisfied. Only action code 0×00 is predefined and means No-Operation. All other codes are application specific and typical application defined codes could do measurement, send predefined event etc.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Action parameter
reg.description: A numeric action parameter can be set and its meaning is application specific.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 2 - originating address
reg.description: Row 2 of decision matrix. Originating address. Set to nickname for node that should trigger action. Oaddr is the originating address. We are only interested in messages from the node given here. 0×00 is segment controller and 0xff is a node without a nickname. If bit 6 of flags is set oaddr will not be checked and events from all nodes will be accepted.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 2: flags
reg.description:
Row 2 of decision matrix. Flags. Set selection behaviour.
 The enable bit can be used to disable a decion matrix row while it is edited.
 The zone and use subzone bits can be activated to have a check on the zone/subzone information of an event. That is the zone/subzone of the machine must match the one of the event to trigger the DM row.

bit.name: Class filter bit 8
bit.description: Defines the ninth bit of the class filter.

bit.name: Class mask bit 8
bit.description: Defines the ninth bit of the class mask.

bit.name: Reserved bit
bit.description: This bit is not used.

bit.description: If set to one subzone should be matched to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Zone match
bit.description: If set to one zone should be matched to trigger DM entry action.

bit.description: If set to one the originating address should be hardcoded to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Check Originating address
bit.description: If set to one the originating address should be checked and match to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Enable
bit.description: Enable (1) or disable (0)the decison matrix row.

abstraction.name: Analog converter A0
abstraction.description: Read to get current analog value for analog to digital converter A0

abstraction.name: Serial baudrate
abstraction.description: Write/read to set/get baudrate for serial channel.

bit.name: Protection timer relay 1
bit.description: When the protection timer for the relay is tiggering a relay action this bit is set.

action.name: Send CLASS1.INFORMATION(20),Type = 18
action.description: CLASS1.INFORMATION(20), Type = 18 (0x12) Good day event is sent.

action.name: Open serial port.
action.description: Open the serial port with the selected baudrate.

param.name: Index
param.description: Index into data from which event data should be sent out on the serial port. Makes it possible to have data after zone/subzone for example by setting it to 2.

action.name: CLASS1.DATA(15), Type = 1
action.description: CLASS1.DATA(15), Type = 1 (0x01) I/O – value event is sent. Se description in events section below.

action.name: CLASS1.DATA(15), Type = 2
action.description: CLASS1.DATA(15), Type = 2 (0x02) A/D value event is sent. Se description in events section below.

action.name: Turn on LED's
action.description: Turn on LED's according to parameter where a bit should be set for a LED to be lit.

action.name: Turn off LED's
action.description: Turn off LED's according to parameter where a bit should be set for a LED to be turned off.

event.name: On Event
event.description: This event will be generated for the joystick of the CAN shield. The datapart of the event will contain information on the joystick direction.

data.name: Zone
data.description: Set to the zone for the module.

data.name: Subzone
data.description: Set to the subzone for the module.

event.name: Button Event
event.description: This event will be generated for the joystick of the CAN shield. The datapart of the event will contain information on the joystick direction.

data.name: Zone
data.description: Set to the zone for the module.

data.name: Subzone
data.description: Set to the subzone for the module.

data.name: Button state
data.description: Always set to zero indicating button has been released.

event.name: Stream Data Event
event.description: Serial data is sent as stream event if enabled.

data.name: Index
data.description: Index of package. Icreased by one for each event sent.

event.name: Stream Data with zone Event
event.description: Serial data is sent as stream event if enabled. Zone and subzone is included.

data.name: Index
data.description: Index of package. Icreased by one for each event sent.

event.name: Good day Event
event.description: CLASS1.INFORMATION(20), Type = 18 (0x12) Good day This event is sent as a result of Action=1.

event.name: I/O value Event
event.description: CLASS1.DATA(15), Type = 1\n This event is sent as a result of Action=5 and/or is sent on regular intervals specified in register 16.

data.name: Data coding.
data.description: Datacoding=0, bitfield. See section 8 in specification.

data.name: I/O bits.
data.description: D3,D4,D5 and D6. The rest of the bits is set to zero.

bit.name: D3
bit.description: Digital value for I/O pin D3

bit.name: D4
bit.description: Digital value for I/O pin D4

bit.name: D5
bit.description: Digital value for I/O pin D5

bit.name: D6
bit.description: Digital value for I/O pin D6

event.name: A/D value Event
event.description: CLASS1.DATA(15), Type = 2 (0x02) A/D value\n This event is sent as a result of Action=5 and/or is sent on regular intervals specified in register 16.

data.name: Data coding.
data.description: Datacoding=96, 16-bit integer. See section 8 in specification.

data.name: MSB of A/D value.
data.description: MSB of analog to digital value for A0.

data.name: LSB of A/D value.
data.description: LSB of analog to digital value for A0.
